abstract: The potential deal would include financial muscle from Microsoft and the investment firm Silver Lake.
snippet: The potential deal would include financial muscle from Microsoft and the investment firm Silver Lake.
lead_paragraph: Dell Inc. neared an agreement on Monday to sell itself to a group led by its founder and the investment firm Silver Lake for more than $23 billion, people briefed on the matter said, in what would be the biggest buyout since the financial crisis.

headline.main: Dell Nears a Buyout of More Than $23 Billion
headline.print_headline: Dell Takeover By Its Founder And Partners Is Expected

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: The Huawei 4Afrika Windows Phone will cost $150 and initially will be sold in seven African countries.
snippet: The Huawei 4Afrika Windows Phone will cost $150 and initially will be sold in seven African countries.
lead_paragraph: BERLIN — Microsoft, taking aim at the world’s fastest-growing smartphone market, said on Monday that it would team up with Huawei of China to sell a low-cost Windows smartphone in Africa.

headline.main: Microsoft and Huawei to Sell Windows Smartphones in Africa
headline.print_headline: Microsoft and Huawei of China to Unite to Sell Low-Cost Windows Smartphones in Africa

abstract: Dell is said to be close to an agreement to sell itself for more than $23 billion. | Liberty Global is in talks to buy Virgin Media. | The Justice Department has filed civil charges against Standard & Poor’s, the nation’s biggest credit-ratings agency. | Regulators scrutinizing Herbalife will have an interesting problem.
snippet: Dell is said to be close to an agreement to sell itself for more than $23 billion. | Liberty Global is in talks to buy Virgin Media. | The Justice Department has filed civil charges against Standard & Poor’s, the nation’s biggest credit-ratings ag...
lead_paragraph: A deal for Dell is almost here. In what would be the biggest buyout since the financial crisis, Dell was close to an agreement to sell itself to a consortium of its founder, Microsoft and the private equity firm Silver Lake for more than $23 billion, people briefed on the matter told DealBook’s Michael J. de la Merced.

abstract: Dell announced that it had agreed to go private in a $24.4 billion deal led by its founder and the investment firm Silver Lake, in the biggest leveraged buyout since the financial crisis.
snippet: Dell announced that it had agreed to go private in a $24.4 billion deal led by its founder and the investment firm Silver Lake, in the biggest leveraged buyout since the financial crisis.

headline.main: Dell in $24 Billion Deal to Go Private
headline.print_headline: Taking Dell Private Is the Biggest Challenge Yet for Its Founder

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced and Quentin Hardy

abstract: Dell shareholders take note. Many management-led buyouts have been successful enriching management at shareholder expense. A look at some of the worst ones shows why.
snippet: Dell shareholders take note. Many management-led buyouts have been successful enriching management at shareholder expense. A look at some of the worst ones shows why.
lead_paragraph: With the help of the private equity firm Silver Lake and Microsoft, Michael S. Dell, the founder and chief executive, is buying back his computer company.

headline.main: Reasons to Be Suspicious of Buyouts Led by Management

abstract: Michael Dell will account for about three-quarters of the deal’s equity. Few other companies have a structure that would allow for anything on Dell’s scale.
snippet: Michael Dell will account for about three-quarters of the deal’s equity. Few other companies have a structure that would allow for anything on Dell’s scale.
lead_paragraph: Dell’s $24 billion leveraged buyout involves essentially a club of one. And Silver Lake Partners, the sole private equity firm included, is not even really the charter member.
